channel.title: History of Post-Apocalyptic RPGs (Part 22: 2018)
channel.description:
![pa banner 2018|690x228](upload://xzY9pvyMFO59zlfOK2AmC7Yo81e.jpeg) On the Gauntlet Blog I continue my look at the History of Post-Apocalyptic RPG with 2018's line up. Transhumanist disasters, fantasy collapses, two different cat-based apocalypses, two different ALL-CAPS titles, a metric ton of zombies, robots, children, samurai, & more.
You can find that post here: https://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/blog/history-of-post-apocalyptic-rpgs-part-22-2018 For the full Gauntlet Blog Calendar, see here: https://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/blog-table-of-contents.html

item.title: History of Post-Apocalyptic RPGs (Part 22: 2018)
item.dc:creator: @edige23
item.description:
@edige23 wrote:

Yes, I have Bitume on the earlier list (1986). I try to include editions from outside the US when I can find info on them. This list has Italian (Dead Air, Sine Requie Anno, Nameless Land), German (HeXXen 1733, Degenesis, TEARS), and French (Journal de l Observateur) sourcebooks and rpgs. Plus at a couple of UK publications. But it’s definitely more spotty on that side of things.

Read full topic

item.title: History of Post-Apocalyptic RPGs (Part 22: 2018)
item.dc:creator: @DeReel
item.description:
@DeReel wrote:

I had missed these historical studies: they are great! Croc’s Bitume in the 80s is a great french RPG. Do you limit the studies to US editors ?

Read full topic
